"'Today'" is a folk rock ballad written by Marty Balin and Paul Kantner from the
band Jefferson Airplane. It first appeared on their breakthrough album,
[[Surrealistic Pillow]], with a live version later appearing on the expanded
rerelease of [[Bless Its Pointed Little Head]]. Marty Balin said, "I wrote it to
try to meet Tony Bennett. He was recording in the next studio. I admired him, so
I thought I'd write him a song. I never got to meet him, but the Airplane ended
up doing it." Surrealistic Pillow 2003 re-release
liner notes Jerry Garcia plays the simple, repetitive but poignant
lead guitar riff on the song.
